title: [P0] Visual Hierarchy Confusion on Dashboard Stat Cards
description: All 6 stat cards (Net Worth, Assets, Debts, Investments, Bills, Income) look identical with no visual differentiation. Users cannot quickly scan what matters most.
reproSteps:
1. Navigate to dashboard
2. Observe all stat cards look the same
3. Try to quickly identify Net Worth vs Debts - no visual difference except small icon color
acceptanceCriteria:
- Net Worth card has prominent gradient background and 4px left border (primary color)
- Debts card has danger-color left border
- Assets/Investments have success-color indicators
- Net Worth value is 36px (larger than other values at 28px)
- Visual scan test: user can identify Net Worth in < 2 seconds

title: [P0] Empty State Failure - Subscriptions and Upcoming Payments
description: When no data exists, users see an infinite loading spinner or blank space with no guidance on what to do next. This blocks new user onboarding.
reproSteps:
1. Login as new user with no data
2. Navigate to dashboard
3. See subscriptions widget showing permanent spinner
4. See upcoming payments list as blank
acceptanceCriteria:
- Replace loading spinner with empty state component after 2s timeout
- Empty state includes: 64px icon, heading, description, CTA button
- CTA opens relevant modal (Add Bill for subscriptions)
- Empty state matches design tokens (see empty-state class in main.css)
- Test with real empty database

title: [P0] Mobile Header Collision on Small Screens
description: Hamburger menu button and login/user dropdown buttons overlap on screens smaller than 375px (iPhone SE, Android compact devices).
reproSteps:
1. Open dashboard on device < 375px width (or resize browser)
2. Observe hamburger menu (top-left) and auth buttons (top-right) overlap
3. Buttons become unclickable
acceptanceCriteria:
- Auth buttons stack below hamburger on screens < 375px
- No overlap or z-index conflicts
- Both buttons remain accessible and clickable
- Main content padding adjusts to account for stacked buttons
- Test on iPhone SE (375x667), Galaxy Fold (280x653 when folded)

title: [P1] Notification Bell Usability Issues
description: Notification bell has multiple UX issues: shows '0' badge when empty, no urgency indicator for overdue bills, dropdown too narrow causing text wrapping.
reproSteps:
1. Check notification bell with 0 notifications - badge still shows
2. Add urgent/overdue notification - no visual urgency
3. Open notification dropdown - long text wraps poorly in narrow dropdown
acceptanceCriteria:
- Badge hidden when count = 0 (data-count='0')
- Urgent notifications trigger pulsing animation on bell icon
- Dropdown width increased to 420px (from 550px per components.css fix)
- Test with various notification text lengths
- Animation respects prefers-reduced-motion

title: [P1] Responsive Grid Breakpoints Incorrect for Desktop
description: Dashboard stat cards use incorrect breakpoints causing desktop users (1920x1080) to see only 2 cards per row instead of 3, wasting horizontal space.
reproSteps:
1. View dashboard on 1920x1080 screen (most common desktop resolution)
2. Observe only 2 stat cards per row
3. Significant wasted space on right side
acceptanceCriteria:
- Change grid classes from 'col-12 col-md-6 col-lg-6 col-xl-4' to 'col-12 col-sm-6 col-lg-4'
- Mobile (< 576px): 1 column
- Tablet (576-991px): 2 columns
- Desktop (992px+): 3 columns
- Test on common resolutions: 1366x768, 1920x1080, 2560x1440

title: [P1] Chart Loading Skeleton Flash and Transition
description: Chart loading skeletons appear abruptly and transition awkwardly to loaded charts. No smooth fade-in animation.
reproSteps:
1. Navigate to dashboard
2. Observe charts loading
3. Notice jarring flash as skeleton disappears and chart appears
acceptanceCriteria:
- Add pulse animation to skeleton (1.5s infinite)
- Chart canvas fades in with opacity transition (400ms ease-in)
- Remove 'loading' class when chart renders
- Add 'loaded' class to trigger fade-in
- Smooth visual experience, no flash

title: [P1] Missing ARIA Labels on Chart Elements
description: All canvas chart elements lack ARIA labels, causing screen readers to announce 'canvas' with no context. Violates WCAG 2.1 AA (1.1.1 Non-text Content).
reproSteps:
1. Enable screen reader (NVDA/JAWS)
2. Navigate to dashboard
3. Tab through chart elements
4. Hear 'canvas' with no description of what data is displayed
acceptanceCriteria:
- Add role='img' to all canvas elements
- Add descriptive aria-label to each chart (e.g., 'Net worth over time chart showing growth from January to February')
- aria-label updates dynamically when chart data changes
- Test with NVDA and JAWS screen readers
- Pass axe DevTools accessibility audit

title: [P1] Stat Cards Not Semantically Structured for Screen Readers
description: Stat cards are plain divs with no semantic structure. Screen readers announce values out of context without knowing what they represent. Violates WCAG 2.1 AA (1.3.1 Info and Relationships).
reproSteps:
1. Enable screen reader
2. Navigate through dashboard stat cards
3. Hear disconnected values like '$150,000' with no context
acceptanceCriteria:
- Add role='region' to stat cards
- Add aria-labelledby pointing to stat label ID
- Add aria-live='polite' to stat values for dynamic updates
- Add id to each stat label
- Test with NVDA and JAWS
- Ensure logical reading order (label → value → trend)

title: [P2] Font Loading Flash (FOUT) on Page Load
description: Page initially renders with system fonts, then 'flashes' when Google Fonts (Inter/Source Serif 4) load. Creates unpolished first impression.
reproSteps:
1. Hard refresh dashboard (Ctrl+Shift+R)
2. Observe text briefly display in system font
3. See flash as custom fonts load
acceptanceCriteria:
- Self-host Inter and Source Serif 4 fonts
- Add font files to /assets/fonts/
- Update @font-face with font-display: swap
- Preload critical font weights
- Test on slow 3G connection
- Measure LCP improvement

title: [P2] Chart Color Palette Lacks Semantic Meaning
description: Charts use random colors for categories with no visual logic. Makes data interpretation harder.
reproSteps:
1. View spending categories chart
2. See random colors assigned to expense types
3. No way to quickly identify positive vs negative data
acceptanceCriteria:
- Establish semantic color rules:
  - Red/Orange: Expenses, debts, outgoing
  - Blue/Cyan: Income, assets, incoming
  - Green: Savings, growth
  - Yellow/Amber: Warnings, alerts
- Update charts.js color assignments
- Add color legend/key where needed
- Test with colorblind users (use accessible palette)

title: [P2] Welcome Button Text Wrapping on Tablet
description: The 'Welcome, [Username]' button has inconsistent text wrapping on tablets (768px-991px). 'Welcome,' prefix hidden via CSS but button doesn't resize smoothly.
reproSteps:
1. View dashboard on tablet (768-991px)
2. Observe 'Welcome,' prefix disappears
3. Button size jumps awkwardly
acceptanceCriteria:
- Smooth transition when welcome-prefix hides
- Button min-width adjusts properly
- Test on iPad (768x1024) and common tablet sizes
- No layout shift (CLS < 0.1)

title: [PERF] Chart.js Not Lazy Loading Despite Comment
description: Code comment claims Chart.js is lazy-loaded, but it's loaded eagerly with defer on every page (270 KB). Impacts performance on pages without charts.
reproSteps:
1. Navigate to settings.html (no charts)
2. Open DevTools Network tab
3. See Chart.js loaded despite no charts on page
acceptanceCriteria:
- Remove Chart.js script tag from HTML
- Add dynamic import to charts.js
- Only load Chart.js on pages with charts
- Measure bundle size reduction on non-chart pages
- Test chart rendering still works

title: [P3] Sidebar Logo Not Vertically Centered
description: Sidebar logo SVG and 'Fireside Capital' text are slightly misaligned (logo appears 2px higher than text baseline).
reproSteps:
1. View sidebar
2. Look closely at logo and text alignment
3. Notice logo sits slightly above text centerline
acceptanceCriteria:
- Logo and text vertically centered using CSS alignment
- Add line-height: 1 to sidebar-brand h4
- Add margin-top: 2px to logo for optical adjustment
- Visual inspection confirms alignment
